TopicTitle: At what altitude can we see the easter eggs

Articles.Content:
Hi,

As I was playing doing low orbiting on the mun, I manage to see one of the easter eggs on it. And I was wondering, at what maximum orbital distance from a planete does the game render the easter eggs?

I would like to try to find them using low orbital pass and just the vanilla game (no mod). Since I don't know where they are.
I know I can see Mun arches from my station at 60km. They're pretty huge.
humm that's cool. that mean I just need to look really hard, because I was about 9km when I saw the arch, and it was small!
At 60km, they must look more like a little shinny dot on your monitor.
Yes, they're a flickering pixel. Probably helps that I'm playing at 2560x1600.

i've had trouble locating easter eggs since .20

the flickering pixel was what i allways looked for when orbiting somewhere and the spots i know are not flickering anymore! but before this i had to be below 70 km.
It's probably best to orbit around 60km or less, find the shining pixel and follow it. at lower altitudes it's best you have terrain scatter off.
I could see the space facility and the island runway from LKO, so I guess somewhere under 100 kilometers depending on your settings?

The mun arches, the [redacted] near the equator, and the [redacted] near the south pole I hear can be seen from orbit. The other three [redacted] can only be seen from like 5km (whatever distance ground scatter objects appear) and then you are looking for something smaller than a pixel.

I can confirm, using the telescope mod, that they are present when orbiting at 85 km. Depending on the sun angle, they may be visible naked-eye, but I'm not sure. They are rendered though. I expect the distance they stop is when the terrain detail switches, which for the past few updates has been around 170 km.

This image was taken from an orbiting craft, using the Ordan telescope mod.

EDIT: Note that this was from 0.18 or 0.19, things may have changed in 0.20
